mdRecord.dcterms:title: Apothecary scale
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This instrument was owned by Dr. James E. Copeland (1845-1937) of Round Hill, Virginia. It was donated to the University of Virginia by Copeland's grandson, Edward V. Copeland, in 1971. Contained in wooden and fabric box; J.E. Copeland, handwritten on bottom of box; two-plate apothecary scale.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Scales (Weighing instruments)
Technology, Pharmaceutical
